channel.title: Need Help with Port Forwarding
channel.description:
My Router has these settings: 1)Dynamic IP 2)Static IP 3)PPTP 4)PPPoE 5)L2TP
**Now currently 4 is selected.**
The router shows: IP address: 10.x.x.x Gateway: 104.x.x.x LAN IP: 192.168.x.x
But when I enable port forwarding for my local LAN machine (192.168.x.x) through some port yyyy. I can only make use of this IP address 10.x.x.x but not the gateway IP 104.x.x.x which looks like the public IP.
So how can I port forward my public IP across the Internet ?

item.title: Need Help with Port Forwarding
item.dc:creator: system
item.description:
This topic was automatically closed 3 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.

Read full topic

item.title: Need Help with Port Forwarding
item.dc:creator: d3stiny255
item.description:
My Router has these settings:
1)Dynamic IP
2)Static IP
3)PPTP
4)PPPoE
5)L2TP

Now currently 4 is selected.

The router shows:
IP address: 10.x.x.x
Gateway: 104.x.x.x
LAN IP: 192.168.x.x

But when I enable port forwarding for my local LAN machine (192.168.x.x) through some port yyyy. I can only make use of this IP address 10.x.x.x but not the gateway IP 104.x.x.x which looks like the public IP.

So how can I port forward my public IP across the Internet ?

Read full topic
